results.headline: A Nightmare Pox on Your Civilized World

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Contagion

results.summary_short: “Contagion,” Steven Soderbergh’s smart, spooky thriller about contemporary plagues, is a paranoid freakout for the antigovernment, Tea Party age.

results.headline: Popular Ascendance to Grim Downfall

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Autobiography of Nicolae Ceausescu

results.summary_short: Andrei Ujica’s documentary “The Autobiography of Nicolae Ceausescu” is a cinematic tour de force that tracks the rise, reign and grim fall of that executed Romanian dictator.

results.headline: From Michigan to Afghanistan, and Back

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Where Soldiers Come From

results.summary_short: “Where Soldiers Come From” follows young military recruits from Michigan to Afghanistan and back.

results.headline: Buddha Stars in a Kung-Fu Flick

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Shaolin

results.summary_short: In “Shaolin,” an evil warlord goes good and fights his former protégé.

results.headline: Life’s Intersections, Random Twists of Fate

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The High Cost of Living

results.summary_short: This debut feature by the Canadian director Deborah Chow is so artistically well-intentioned and earnest in its ambitions that you can almost forgive the banality of its every scene.

results.headline: A Tumultuous Time, Captured by Outsiders

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Black Power Mixtape 1967-1975

results.summary_short: “The Black Power Mixtape 1967-1975” is a fascinating collection of images and interviews by Swedish television journalists who traveled to the United States to chronicle the era.

results.headline: Rich Girls Have All Kind of Drama

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tanner Hall

results.summary_short: Rooney Mara stars in the teenage drama “Tanner Hall.”

results.headline: Finding Romance in All Kinds of Places

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Love In Space

results.summary_short: Aaron Kwok and René Liu star in the comedy “Love in Space.”

results.headline: There’s Something Odd About This Hospital

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Grave Encounters

results.summary_short: “Grave Encounters” is a mockumentary set in a familiar setting, a spooky old asylum.

results.headline: Muslim High School Football Players Stay Close to Home

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Fordson: Faith, Fasting, and Football

results.summary_short: In “Fordson: Faith, Fasting, Football,” Muslim high school players face their crosstown rivals.

results.headline: Easy Money From Body Parts

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Burke and Hare

results.summary_short: “Burke & Hare,” a ghoulish comedy, is a droll take on one of the most notorious mass-murder cases of the 19th century.

results.headline: No Plot, No Story, No Kicks: Want to Back My Movie?

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Brother's Justice

results.summary_short: Dax Shepard in “Brother’s Justice” tries to interest someone — anyone — in a martial-arts movie.

results.headline: When He Was Good, He Was Very, Very Good

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Bobby Fischer Against the World

results.summary_short: “Bobby Fischer Against the World” documents the moment when Fischer’s brilliance at chess made him an international hero.

results.headline: Fear and Loathing at Parker Prep

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Beware the Gonzo

results.summary_short: “Beware the Gonzo,” the feature directorial debut of Bryan Goluboff, follows a student uprising against a high school’s vile clique of alpha teenagers and its smug principal.

results.headline: Moseying in Thailand as a Sad, Distant Slacker

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hi-So

results.summary_short: Aditya Assarat’s “Hi-So” chronicles the cultural alienation felt by a Thai student returning home after finishing college in America.

results.headline: Huge Teeth and Teenie-Weenie Bikinis

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Shark Night 3D

results.summary_short: “Shark Night 3D” is the latest entry in the bobbing-and-bloodbath category.

results.headline: Pay Attention, Houston: We Have Company

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Apollo 18

results.summary_short: In the science-fiction thriller “Apollo 18,” a secret mission to the Moon turns out to be filled with otherworldly dangers.

results.headline: Decoding the Puzzling Messages of a Recluse
results.display_title: Resurrect Dead: The Mystery of the Toynbee Tiles

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Resurrect Dead: The Mystery of the Toynbee Tiles

results.summary_short: Jon Foy follows three intrepid “detectives” on the trail of the creator of tiles emblazoned with puzzling messages in this documentary.

results.headline: Teenage Romance Blossoms, Twistedly

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Love Exposure

results.summary_short: Sion Sono’s “Love Exposure,” a teenage romance, is an unexpectedly involving and relentlessly entertaining collision of contradictions.

results.headline: The Aftershocks of an Adoption Long Ago, Felt by Everyone Involved
results.display_title: I'm Glad that My Mother is Alive

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of I'm Glad that My Mother is Alive

results.summary_short: “I’m Glad My Mother Is Alive,” directed by the father-son team of Claude and Nathan Miller, focuses on the psychological profile of a boy who finds the woman who gave him up for adoption.
